result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen G. Baxter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined - hearing requested.  Upon determination of restitution- amount shall be paid within 6 months.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  Hearing requested.
 If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  May Not have contact with victims.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen G. Baxter

249  Clerk HM.  State appears by ADA Jessica Krejcarek.    DE appears in custody and with Atty Angela Komp.  Victims in 15CM363 adn 15CM389 appear.   Parties have an agreement.   DE stips to restitution in the amt of $570 in 15CM363 and zero restitution in 15CM389.   So ordered.   Order shall be forwarded to Br. 3.
Restitution hearing on June 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
For Ct 3 only - Dismissed and read in.
For restitution in the amount of: $14.24
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  15CM333/15CM363/15CM389/15CM429.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (15CM389) w/Atty Komp.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

15CM363 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 3 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.
15CM389 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty the Court.  Count 3 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.
15CM333 - dismissed & read-in on State's motion.
15CM429 - dismissed on State's motion.

Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.

Restitution is ordered; defense counsel requests restitution hrg.
DNA ordered; notice given to deft
If revoked - deft requests credit for (4) days in file 15CM363 & (28) days in 15CM389.
Bond to apply to court costs; balance to be returned to poster.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA J Hinshaw
